txt.en:
'I've received a most distressing letter! My good friend Dora -- she's a chicken farmer near Waymeet -- has written to say that a pack of wolves has invaded the Shire and driven her from her farm! She's staying in Waymeet for the time being, but the sooner she can get her farm back, the better!

'Can you help? Just take the north-east road right to the centre of Waymeet. You just tell Dora Brownlock that I've sent you to help with her wolf problem.

'Wolves in the Shire! What's going on in the world these days?'

'Peony sent you to help me, [placeholder]? She's a sweet lady, and a good friend! I'm glad to have your help.\n\n'Yes, the wolves came slavering near to Waymeet recently and seemed to head straight for my farm! It was all I could do to escape to Waymeet without them noticing me!'
'Dora Brownlock is a good friend of mine, so you'd best hurry to Waymeet, if you don't want your superiors to hear of this. Wolves! I can hardly believe it! In this day and age!'
Peony Grubb has received word from her friend Dora Brownlock, a chicken farmer in Waymeet, that wolves have invaded the Shire and are threatening the town.
Dora Brownlock is at the centre of Waymeet, north-east of Michel Delving.\n\nPeony Grubb has asked you to help her friend Dora with the wolves that have taken over her farm.
